dt: {bc}a young knight who follows the banner of another
{bc}a person who has received a degree from a college, university, or professional school usually after four years of study
{bc}a male animal (such as a fur seal) without a mate during breeding time

et: Middle English {it}bacheler{/it} "knight lacking retainers, squire, young man (especially an unmarried one), person holding the lowest university degree," borrowed from Anglo-French, going back to Medieval Latin {it}*baccalāris{/it}, variant of {it}baccalārius, bachelārius{/it} "serf without land living in the lord's household, vassal lacking a fief, knight without retainers, young clerk, student," of obscure origin
shortdef: a young knight who follows the banner of another
a person who has received a degree from a college, university, or professional school usually after four years of study; also : the degree itself

dt: {bc}a European composite ({it}Centaurea cyanus{/it}) having flower heads with usually blue, pink, or white rays that is often cultivated in North America

shortdef: a European composite (Centaurea cyanus) having flower heads with usually blue, pink, or white rays that is often cultivated in North America —called also cornflower

dt: {bc}a degree that is given to a student by a college or university usually after four years of study

shortdef: a degree that is given to a student by a college or university usually after four years of study
